user_prompt:
You are an agent designed to generate text from data for a data-to-text natural language generation. 
You can be provided data in the form of xml, table, meaning representations, graphs etc.
Your task is to generate the appropriate text given the data information without omitting any field or adding extra information in essence called hallucination.

Dataset: webnlg

Here is the data, now generate text using the provided data:

Data: ['Alan_B._Miller_Hall | architect | Robert_A._M._Stern', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | address | "101 Ukrop Way"', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | currentTenants | Mason_School_of_Business', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | location | Williamsburg,_Virginia', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | owner | College_of_William_&_Mary']
Output:
final_response: Alan B. Miller Hall is located at 101 Ukrop Way in Williamsburg, Virginia. The building was designed by architect Robert A. M. Stern and is owned by the College of William & Mary. Its current tenants are the Mason School of Business.
